16// The Serializer/Deserializer class is a common superclass for Serializer and
17// Deserializer which is used to store common constants and methods used by
18// both.
19class SerializerDeserializer : public RootVisitor {
20 public:
21 static void IterateStartupObjectCache(Isolate* isolate, RootVisitor* visitor);
22
23 static void IterateSharedHeapObjectCache(Isolate* isolate,
24 RootVisitor* visitor);
25
26 protected:
27 enum class SlotType {
28 kAnySlot,
29 kMapSlot,
30 };
31 static bool CanBeDeferred(Tagged<HeapObject> o, SlotType slot_type);
32
33 void RestoreExternalReferenceRedirector(Isolate* isolate,
34 Tagged<AccessorInfo> accessor_info);
35 void RestoreExternalReferenceRedirector(
36 Isolate* isolate, Tagged<FunctionTemplateInfo> function_template_info);
37
38 // clang-format off
39#define UNUSED_SERIALIZER_BYTE_CODES(V) \
40 /* Free range 0x20..0x2f */ \
41 V(0x20) V(0x21) V(0x22) V(0x23) V(0x24) V(0x25) V(0x26) V(0x27) \
42 V(0x28) V(0x29) V(0x2a) V(0x2b) V(0x2c) V(0x2d) V(0x2e) V(0x2f) \
43 /* Free range 0x30..0x3f */ \
44 V(0x30) V(0x31) V(0x32) V(0x33) V(0x34) V(0x35) V(0x36) V(0x37) \
45 V(0x38) V(0x39) V(0x3a) V(0x3b) V(0x3c) V(0x3d) V(0x3e) V(0x3f) \
46 /* Free range 0x97..0x9f */ \
47 V(0x98) V(0x99) V(0x9a) V(0x9b) V(0x9c) V(0x9d) V(0x9e) V(0x9f) \
48 /* Free range 0xa0..0xaf */ \
49 V(0xa0) V(0xa1) V(0xa2) V(0xa3) V(0xa4) V(0xa5) V(0xa6) V(0xa7) \
50 V(0xa8) V(0xa9) V(0xaa) V(0xab) V(0xac) V(0xad) V(0xae) V(0xaf) \
51 /* Free range 0xb0..0xbf */ \
52 V(0xb0) V(0xb1) V(0xb2) V(0xb3) V(0xb4) V(0xb5) V(0xb6) V(0xb7) \
53 V(0xb8) V(0xb9) V(0xba) V(0xbb) V(0xbc) V(0xbd) V(0xbe) V(0xbf) \
54 /* Free range 0xc0..0xcf */ \
55 V(0xc0) V(0xc1) V(0xc2) V(0xc3) V(0xc4) V(0xc5) V(0xc6) V(0xc7) \
56 V(0xc8) V(0xc9) V(0xca) V(0xcb) V(0xcc) V(0xcd) V(0xce) V(0xcf) \
57 /* Free range 0xd0..0xdf */ \
58 V(0xd0) V(0xd1) V(0xd2) V(0xd3) V(0xd4) V(0xd5) V(0xd6) V(0xd7) \
59 V(0xd8) V(0xd9) V(0xda) V(0xdb) V(0xdc) V(0xdd) V(0xde) V(0xdf) \
60 /* Free range 0xe0..0xef */ \
61 V(0xe0) V(0xe1) V(0xe2) V(0xe3) V(0xe4) V(0xe5) V(0xe6) V(0xe7) \
62 V(0xe8) V(0xe9) V(0xea) V(0xeb) V(0xec) V(0xed) V(0xee) V(0xef) \
63 /* Free range 0xf0..0xff */ \
64 V(0xf0) V(0xf1) V(0xf2) V(0xf3) V(0xf4) V(0xf5) V(0xf6) V(0xf7) \
65 V(0xf8) V(0xf9) V(0xfa) V(0xfb) V(0xfc) V(0xfd) V(0xfe) V(0xff)
66 // clang-format on
67
68 // The static assert below will trigger when the number of preallocated spaces
69 // changed. If that happens, update the kNewObject and kBackref bytecode
70 // ranges in the comments below.
71 static_assert(4 == kNumberOfSnapshotSpaces);
72
73 // First 32 root array items.
74 static const int kRootArrayConstantsCount = 0x20;
75
76 // 32 common raw data lengths.
77 static const int kFixedRawDataCount = 0x20;
78 // 16 repeats lengths.
79 static const int kFixedRepeatCount = 0x10;
80
81 // 8 hot (recently seen or back-referenced) objects with optional skip.
82 static const int kHotObjectCount = 8;
83
84 enum Bytecode : uint8_t {
85 //
86 // ---------- byte code range 0x00..0x1f ----------
87 //
88
89 // 0x00..0x03 Allocate new object, in specified space.
90 kNewObject = 0x00,
91 // Reference to previously allocated object.
92 kBackref = 0x04,
93 // Reference to an object in the read only heap.
94 kReadOnlyHeapRef,
95 // Object in the startup object cache.
96 kStartupObjectCache,
97 // Root array item.
98 kRootArray,
99 // Object provided in the attached list.
100 kAttachedReference,
101 // Object in the shared heap object cache.
102 kSharedHeapObjectCache,
103 // Do nothing, used for padding.
104 kNop,
105 // A tag emitted at strategic points in the snapshot to delineate sections.
106 // If the deserializer does not find these at the expected moments then it
107 // is an indication that the snapshot and the VM do not fit together.
108 // Examine the build process for architecture, version or configuration
109 // mismatches.
110 kSynchronize,
111 // Repeats of variable length.
112 kVariableRepeat,
113 // Used for embedder-allocated backing stores for TypedArrays.
114 kOffHeapBackingStore,
115 kOffHeapResizableBackingStore,
116 // Used for embedder-provided serialization data for embedder fields.
117 kEmbedderFieldsData,
118 // Used for embedder-provided serialziation data for API wrappers.
119 kApiWrapperFieldsData,
120 // Raw data of variable length.
121 kVariableRawData,
122 // Used to encode external references provided through the API.
123 kApiReference,
124 // External reference referenced by id.
125 kExternalReference,
126 // Same as three bytecodes above but for serializing sandboxed external
127 // pointer values.
128 // TODO(v8:10391): Remove them once all ExternalPointer usages are
129 // sandbox-ready.
130 kSandboxedApiReference,
131 kSandboxedExternalReference,
132 kSandboxedRawExternalReference,
133 // In-place weak references.
134 kClearedWeakReference,
135 kWeakPrefix,
136 // Registers the current slot as a "pending" forward reference, to be later
137 // filled by a corresponding resolution bytecode.
138 kRegisterPendingForwardRef,
139 // Resolves an existing "pending" forward reference to point to the current
140 // object.
141 kResolvePendingForwardRef,
142 // Special construction bytecodes for the metamaps. In theory we could
143 // re-use forward-references for this, but then the forward reference would
144 // be registered during object map deserialization, before the object is
145 // allocated, so there wouldn't be a allocated object whose map field we can
146 // register as the pending field. We could either hack around this, or
147 // simply introduce this new bytecode.
148 kNewContextlessMetaMap,
149 kNewContextfulMetaMap,
150 // When the sandbox is enabled, a prefix indicating that the following
151 // object is referenced through an indirect pointer, i.e. through an entry
152 // in a pointer table.
153 kIndirectPointerPrefix,
154 // When the sandbox is enabled, this bytecode instructs the deserializer to
155 // initialize the "self" indirect pointer of trusted objects, which
156 // references the object's pointer table entry. As the "self" indirect
157 // pointer is always the first field after the map word, it is guaranteed
158 // that it will be deserialized before any inner objects, which may require
159 // the pointer table entry for back reference to the trusted object.
160 kInitializeSelfIndirectPointer,
161 // A prefix indicating that the following object is referenced through a
162 // protected pointer, i.e. a pointer from one trusted object to another.
163 kProtectedPointerPrefix,
164
165 //
166 // ---------- byte code range 0x40..0x7f ----------
167 //
168
169 // 0x40..0x5f
170 kRootArrayConstants = 0x40,
171
172 // 0x60..0x7f
173 kFixedRawData = 0x60,
174
175 //
176 // ---------- byte code range 0x80..0x9f ----------
177 //
178
179 // 0x80..0x8f
180 kFixedRepeat = 0x80,
181
182 // 0x90..0x97
183 kHotObject = 0x90,
184 };
185
186 // Helper class for encoding and decoding a value into and from a bytecode.
187 //
188 // The value is encoded by allocating an entire bytecode range, and encoding
189 // the value as an index in that range, starting at kMinValue; thus the range
190 // of values
191 // [kMinValue, kMinValue + 1, ... , kMaxValue]
192 // is encoded as
193 // [kBytecode, kBytecode + 1, ... , kBytecode + (N - 1)]
194 // where N is the number of values, i.e. kMaxValue - kMinValue + 1.
195 template <Bytecode kBytecode, int kMinValue, int kMaxValue,
196 typename TValue = int>
197 struct BytecodeValueEncoder {
198 static_assert((kBytecode + kMaxValue - kMinValue) <= kMaxUInt8);
199
200 static constexpr bool IsEncodable(TValue value) {
201 return base::IsInRange(static_cast<int>(value), kMinValue, kMaxValue);
202 }
203
204 static constexpr uint8_t Encode(TValue value) {
205 DCHECK(IsEncodable(value));
206 return static_cast<uint8_t>(kBytecode + static_cast<int>(value) -
207 kMinValue);
208 }
209
210 static constexpr TValue Decode(uint8_t bytecode) {
211 DCHECK(base::IsInRange(bytecode, Encode(static_cast<TValue>(kMinValue)),
212 Encode(static_cast<TValue>(kMaxValue))));
213 return static_cast<TValue>(bytecode - kBytecode + kMinValue);
214 }
215 };
216
217 template <Bytecode bytecode>
218 using SpaceEncoder =
219 BytecodeValueEncoder<bytecode, 0, kNumberOfSnapshotSpaces - 1,
220 SnapshotSpace>;
221
222 using NewObject = SpaceEncoder<kNewObject>;
223
224 //
225 // Some other constants.
226 //
227
228 // Sentinel after a new object to indicate that double alignment is needed.
229 static const int kDoubleAlignmentSentinel = 0;
230
231 // Raw data size encoding helpers.
232 static const int kFirstEncodableFixedRawDataSize = 1;
233 static const int kLastEncodableFixedRawDataSize =
234 kFirstEncodableFixedRawDataSize + kFixedRawDataCount - 1;
235
236 using FixedRawDataWithSize =
237 BytecodeValueEncoder<kFixedRawData, kFirstEncodableFixedRawDataSize,
238 kLastEncodableFixedRawDataSize>;
239
240 // Repeat count encoding helpers.
241 static const int kFirstEncodableRepeatCount = 2;
242 static const int kLastEncodableFixedRepeatCount =
243 kFirstEncodableRepeatCount + kFixedRepeatCount - 1;
244 static const int kFirstEncodableVariableRepeatCount =
245 kLastEncodableFixedRepeatCount + 1;
246
247 using FixedRepeatWithCount =
248 BytecodeValueEncoder<kFixedRepeat, kFirstEncodableRepeatCount,
249 kLastEncodableFixedRepeatCount>;
250
251 // Encodes/decodes repeat count into a serialized variable repeat count
252 // value.
253 struct VariableRepeatCount {
254 static constexpr bool IsEncodable(int repeat_count) {
255 return repeat_count >= kFirstEncodableVariableRepeatCount;
256 }
257
258 static constexpr int Encode(int repeat_count) {
259 DCHECK(IsEncodable(repeat_count));
260 return repeat_count - kFirstEncodableVariableRepeatCount;
261 }
262
263 static constexpr int Decode(int value) {
264 return value + kFirstEncodableVariableRepeatCount;
265 }
266 };
267
268 using RootArrayConstant =
269 BytecodeValueEncoder<kRootArrayConstants, 0, kRootArrayConstantsCount - 1,
270 RootIndex>;
271 using HotObject = BytecodeValueEncoder<kHotObject, 0, kHotObjectCount - 1>;
272
273 // This backing store reference value represents empty backing stores during
274 // serialization/deserialization.
275 static const uint32_t kEmptyBackingStoreRefSentinel = 0;
276};
277
278struct SerializeEmbedderFieldsCallback {
279 explicit SerializeEmbedderFieldsCallback(
280 v8::SerializeInternalFieldsCallback js_cb =
281 v8::SerializeInternalFieldsCallback(),
282 v8::SerializeContextDataCallback context_cb =
283 v8::SerializeContextDataCallback(),
284 v8::SerializeAPIWrapperCallback api_wrapper_cb =
285 v8::SerializeAPIWrapperCallback())
286 : js_object_callback(js_cb),
287 context_callback(context_cb),
288 api_wrapper_callback(api_wrapper_cb) {}
289 v8::SerializeInternalFieldsCallback js_object_callback;
290 v8::SerializeContextDataCallback context_callback;
291 v8::SerializeAPIWrapperCallback api_wrapper_callback;
292};
293
294struct DeserializeEmbedderFieldsCallback {
295 explicit DeserializeEmbedderFieldsCallback(
296 v8::DeserializeInternalFieldsCallback js_cb =
297 v8::DeserializeInternalFieldsCallback(),
298 v8::DeserializeContextDataCallback context_cb =
299 v8::DeserializeContextDataCallback(),
300 v8::DeserializeAPIWrapperCallback api_wrapper_cb =
301 v8::DeserializeAPIWrapperCallback())
302 : js_object_callback(js_cb),
303 context_callback(context_cb),
304 api_wrapper_callback(api_wrapper_cb) {}
305 v8::DeserializeInternalFieldsCallback js_object_callback;
306 v8::DeserializeContextDataCallback context_callback;
307 v8::DeserializeAPIWrapperCallback api_wrapper_callback;
308};
309} // namespace internal
310} // namespace v8
